comment: I just took Dr. Kim for COM 2020 and I had a very positive experience from his course. He is definitely a hit or miss because he is a tough grader, but its because he truly cares for his students success. If you attend class everyday on time, pay attention, and submit assignments on time, you'll be golden. Easy A for those who care.

One of my favorite professors i've ever had. He's a nice guy who will work with you if you participate in his class. There's one paper due (you work on it all semester) and a couple quizzes. He does have a thick accent which can be difficult to understand at times. I've taken no notes all semester and his powerpoints are all online to read.

Simple class. Weekly discussion posts, multiple choice quizzes every 2-3 weeks based off in class powerpoints (posted online too), bigger assignments once a month which are parts of your research paper that he'll give feedback on & you'll combine the parts at the end to turn in as your final paper. Just do the work & show up & you'll be fine.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: he is a very sweet guy who will help you, as long as you respect his rubric and guidelines. The whole semester we spent writing a research paper and that was technically our final, and he has been very helpful with feedback. He is very hard to understand, but be patient with him.

I took this class half and half due to COVID last spring. He was very nice and caring, we spoke several times outside of class. the tests were super easy and the papers also weren't hard; he was an easy grader. this one time in class he showed an episode of Blue's Clues to try to explain some communication concept, it was very funny

I took him for Com2020, and made a mistake by taking him again. he does not communicate. i wouldnt recommend him to anyone. this class (& even com2020) he used another professors work. however, the issue is, he doesnt communicate with feedback. he doesnt want us to follow certain instructions but doesnt inform his students

Professor Kim might be a wonderful professor in person but I would not take his class again online. If you watch the lectures that are online by another professor dont expect that to be what he wants despite giving few instructions. There was very little communication during the semester. If you are looking for a straightforward class dont take.

He uses Dr. Daws online lectures and provides no additional information from what you learn from her, so pretty much all he does is grade. He is difficult to understand through email and also gives terrible feedback when you try to ask for help.

If you do the assignments and follow his simple instructions youll do fine. No tests so dont worry about retaining the content after you turn in the assignment(the content is very abstract and hard to understand anyways). Only 3 projects, 5 DPs and 2 short reflection papers. His English is not too good, so read instructions carefully.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: Weekly discussion posts, a few quizzes, and a big paper make up this class. The paper is divided into sections that will be do throughout the semester, so not bad at all. The discussions are probably the "hardest" part but even those aren't bad. If you do the work and actually try, you will be completely fine.

This professor is the worst I've taken in a while. He is hard to understand and it's even harder to communicate with him. It is unbelievably frustrating to try and have a conversation with him as he attempts to put words in your mouth and then scolds you if he thinks that those words are wrong. This is a boring class, but he makes it much worse.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects--So many papers

comment: Professor Ted is a very kind and knowledgable teacher but the language barrier between teacher and students makes the class quite confusing. I almost never knew what was going on during class but I made good grades in the homework assignments ("labs") which allowed me to get an A. It's not a hard class but take him with caution.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Dr. Ted has a Korean accent, which can make him a bit hard to understand at times. Other than that, he is very willing to explain to you what he wants and help you. He knows what he is talking about, so don't be intimidated by his direct style of criticism, he just wants to help you. COM2020 is confusing enough on it's own, be nice to Ted!

I do not understand how this man has a career in communications because of his complete lack of being able to communicate with his students. I have stayed after class to discuss with him multiple times and I only leave more confused every time. I would never take another class with him just out of the pure frustration I experience every class time

Kim is a hard person to communicate with, email and in person. He has a very thick accent, and interrupts when you talk to him. Attendance is mandatory and monitored very closely (only 2 free misses the entire semester). Lots of outside class work, but he will cancel class or let class out super early to "compensate" for our work.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Prof Kim is a nice and funny guy. He does have a thick accent so it can be hard to understand him at times. He mentions needing the textbook, but I didn't use it once. You have plenty of assignments that are outlined exactly how he wants you to complete them. If you're good at following instructions then this is your class!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Prof. Kim is a fun guy, but his classes are often fairly useless and dont really cover much important material. Attendance is extremely monitored, but the only important part of the class is to make sure you get the weekly assignments done on time. He isnt a tough grader, and as long as you show at least a little effort you can get an A or B.

Everything is straightforward. HOWEVER, attendance is mandatory, make sure you have great group members, do all the assignments, and the test are mostly from the PowerPoints. I never opened my book ! Hes an okay teacher, the subject is just really boring

I am not fan of this professor at all. The weekly labs are repetitive and tedious. Unfortunately, the class is so boring its hard to stay awake because of his broken English & reading directly off the ppts. He also says that being a student is our only job so we have to come to every class, even though that is not the reality for a lot of us.

Oh Ted. The man cares about his subject and his students, but it's just plain difficult to communicate with him, online or in person. His lectures are boring but you need to show up, and on time. His test questions are unclear and so difficult to understand. However, it's easy to earn points back on the individual assignments.

Prof. Kim is a bit intimidating at first. He does not give you any slack. He will try to scare you that his class will be very hard but it honestly is not. His lectures are very boring but you have to show up. Each day missed counts off on your final grade. He definitely isn't out to make friends with students but do your work and you will be fine.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Prof. Kim is wonderful. He is so funny and really cares about what hes teaching. His attitude totally reflects that of the class, so be nice and hell be nice right back. Hes a pretty tough grader, just make sure you follow his directions exactly. If youre not sure, hes quick to respond to emails.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: Lab Assignments weekly but they are very simple. I mainly used this class to do homework for my other classes because the lectures were so boring and you will learn nothing. It's not really his fault because there is close to no material for this class. Forget asking questions. He has no clue what you're saying. Extra credit. Very easy class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Do the extra credit. I needed the extra points by the end of the semester! You work with the same group the entire term so chose wisely, plus 10 pg. paper at the end. His Korean accent makes lectures super hard to understand, but he's incredibly smart! Powerpoints online, tests are tough so I suggest you actually study.
A professor that truly wants you to succeed! He's excellent! He makes a tough subject easy.

The class was ok, he's funny. Assignments aren't bad but there are a lot of them. Group project can be awful depending on teammates. Easy grader when it comes to written assignments, but his tests and quizzes are tougher. Had a group presentation, group research paper, and cumulative final all due in the last week of the class, which was overkill.

Great Professor. A lot of students struggled in my class, but I found it rather easy. There is semester long group project which is fairly simple, as well as 4 short ind. papers. Tests/quizzes were kinda iffy, but there are very few and I did well on them. Didn't use the book once, he teaches directly off slides. He also provides study guides!

Professor Kim was great. I really enjoyed his class because he cares for his students. Unlike other professors, he wants you to learn and he wants you to understand. If are confused or have questions, feel free to ask, he will be happy to answer you. I think his class is about effort. His test can be difficult but if you study you will be fine.
Awful. Difficult to understand. Learned nothing. Group Research Paper is the worst. Attendance is mandatory but prepared to be bored and learn absolutely nothing.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Lectures are pretty boring, the exams are harder than expected and he says he pulls them from his notes but they don't seem to be pulled from there. I wish I took a more understandable professor for this class because I honestly feel like I learned nothing in his class.

Kim is not specific in his grading criteria at all. I would often ask him a direct question and he would never really answer it. He does take attendance and there is a semester long group project that could be brutal if you pick the wrong members. Also, prepare for a 10 page research paper

Great professor! He really cares about his students and if you are willing to work, he will help you. He knows it is a challenging class and he makes sure that you have the resources necessary for it.

He's okay. His accent takes a toll on almost all assignments. He expects you to have "proper etiquettes" when emailing him but he never responds.. projects are easy A but midterm and final are what you have to work for. His class is fairly boring. Propbably my least favorite class taken this semester.

Dr. Kim is a very sweet, funny man who tries his best to make class interesting. Unfortunately, Research Methods is a very boring subject & there's a bit of a language barrier. You can understand about 75% of what he says, and he understands probably about 70% of what you say. Not a terribly difficult class. Easy B if you do the bare minimum.

Professor Ted  really wants everyone to do well and will try his best to help. But the language barrier is hard in this class it is really hard to understand him even though he is willing to repeat anything you cant understand. He is also a very easy work so if you do the work you will pass no problem

Ted is great! Very clear on what he wants and expects on his assignments. Sometimes a little hard to understand but just ask and he will repeat himself. Only 2 tests- midterm and final. A couple quizzes that aren't too hard. Main focus is the group research paper that's broken into segments so it's really not bad. Would take again!

I thought this class was gonna be a lot worse than it was. There's a few quizzes, little to no homework, two big tests and the big group project/paper. He breaks up  due dates for the assignments so you're not writing a 15+ page paper at the end of the semester. If you have a good topic and a good group, you'll be fine. Would definitely recommend!

Although his English is not his first language, he will try to make sure that you understand him. Overall it is a very easy class, however the attendance policy is pretty ridiculous. After 2 missed classes you lose points off your final grade. Would have made an A without policy. The scope of the whole class is just an easy 7 page group paper.

The entire class is a group project. The workload is lighter compared to previous sems. There is a language barrier, but he'll repeat things over  b/c he WANTS you to understand the material. Very nice. Work on your selected research question, 7 pg paper WITH group and present. 2 tests & quizzes. Quizzes easy STUDY for test. Can miss 2 classes.

I loved Ted.  He really wants you to succeed.  He's sometimes hard to understand because of his accent, but he knows this and will repeat himself as many times as necessary.  He's also pretty funny.  He grades fairly and always answers emails quickly.  I would take him again in a heartbeat.

Great Professor! Very helpful and fair. He wants everyone in class to succeed. He has an accent and is a little hard to understand, but he will clarify as much as you need him to. He does not make the class any harder than it needs to be and understands that most of us have other classes and jobs. Would definitely recommend!

Prof. Kim is such a sweet person. He is very kind, but is a little difficult to understand because of his accent. But man does he try! His lectures are dry, but if you read, you will understand. He's such a nice person, but this class DEFINITELY does not need to be a required course for KSU Com majors..I have to say I didn't learn much.

Good overall! The only complaint I have is that, while he will answer any questions you have, he is a bit passive aggressive when doing so. Sometimes you just need clarity on an assignment (better safe than sorry) and he will respond to an email, but include something like "Check the syllabus before asking me questions."

I love Professor Ted. He can be hard to understand but he really tries and loves what he teaches. He's helpful and will do everything he can to make you understand him. The material he teaches isn't fun but he is the best at teaching it. He is awesome and I'd take him again if I had to!

Ted is the man. He doesn't speak great English, but he will repeat himself 100 times to make sure you are both on the same page. He has trimmed the final paper from 30 pages to 15, and 7 of them were literature review, which was easy. Tests were straight from online quizzes offered in the book. Easy A for a 3000 level class. Just try.
Difficult to understand, but a nice professor that will help if you ask. Confusing material and a huge research paper closes out the semester. Would not take again.

He doesn't speak English well at all. But he tries really really hard to make sure you do well, and everything is so easy if you just really focus on understanding him. He's a nice guy and he's funny too sometimes. He is helpful. I took him for Comm Research Methods and he made the class a lot less scary.
